messages.content:
Some quick info on **$HYPE**
- Is going to be released during phase #3 
- The only way that you can earn it is through the bounty platform or airdrop
- Contributors will hold the most **$HYPE**
- Hyperscale will issue bounties that reward members in **$HYPE**
- **$HYPE** will initially be backed by our treasury and can be traded for stablecoins (we'll supply our own liquidity)

Please discus ideas and provide feedback!
cc: @nicklinck
Thanks for the info! Will the treasury be backed by the initial 10 mil from Sam?
Do we mint new tokens by contributing stable coins to the treasury?
Yup!
Not initially
So a capped supply upon the initial investment? And then as we get more investments, we mint more?
Not capped supply. We (as the fund) can mint more by adding more stablecoins to the treasury
Also, will $HYPE be given to DAOs we invest in, or HYPE is primarily for bounties?
Both
cool, any governance power with tokens?
If we have something to vote on yes. This isn't currently the case
Any information on initial distributions to certain people via airdrop or initial exchange rates?
HELLO
how to get airdrop?

@nicklinck small suggestion. Nothing wrong with $HYPE ticker of course, but would the DAO consider taking a step in the direction of an emoji ticker ($⚡️⚡️). I’ve done it with $🇺🇸 as an experiment and it looks great in a wallet
Contribute
Most of the airdrop will go to the people who contributed the most
Airdrop size is tbd
Are runs on the treasury possible? Is there a guarantee that the treasury will contain enough stablecoins to redeem all $HYPE or will the treasury only contain a fractional reserve?
No fractional reserve haha
1:1 backed
Super important to clarify. Will the treasury that holds the 1:1 stablecoins also hold the 5% of tokens from the projects that HS backs? Or will those tokens be held separately?
More like 1:20 backed
So **$HYPE** has a 20 USD floor
We'll hold the DAO tokens in a separate treasury and merge them both at a later stage
Most of this is TBD

Yeah, I figured 😀 . Just wanted to point out some important issues to think through. If the tokens have governance rights that exercise control over the treasury, then there are important tax implications for $HYPE holders when the contents of the treasury change.
The main idea here is that we'll have a bounty system to compensate for work
And also reward people for past work
Hyperscale is run by contributors
Love the approach. Interested in thinking through how contributors that get $HYPE also can get exposure to the upside from the projects HS backs.

We've talked quite a bit about this in #referral-program.
I'd prefer a more holistic $HYPE approach, especially as the $HYPE can rise against the underlying as the projects funded by $HYPE mature.
https://discord.com/channels/916751469678579784/916849735439093760/918469500544892948

Awarding a little $HYPE for referrals, a lot for analysis.
Cross participation for funded companies.

Also, per governance, a simple "has the gold, makes the rules", especially in picking companies, doesn't result in the best outcome.
Also, bounties don't respect anything but speed - maintainability and security go out the window. What's the plan for bounties?
How does the distribution of upside work vis treasury appreciation?

thanks for the info on $HYPE. Few questions. looks like we can earn by accomplishing tasks via the bounty system. since to my knowledge the system hasn't launched yet, is the team tracking contributions in discord and elsewhere and are such contributions eligible for $HYPE airdrop? IE: Does contributing to marketing/PR stuff qualify for an airdrop? thanks!

Ex: Here's an example proposal for an alternative voting system/reward system for picking companies/managing the organization, as well as a worked example you can play with: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ZBLjm1wD9mITtZsSkPUrmsTfJGoWQ_0lkAfVAAkus2c/edit#

Happy to discuss/take comments.

embeds.title: DRAFT: HyperscaleDAO Voting Proposal - Meritocratic Quadratic Voting
embeds.description: HyperscaleDAO Voting Proposal - Meritocratic Quadratic Voting Introduction DAOs enable a large number of untrusted participants to coordinate and make decisions at scale. Traditional VC firms consist of a small number of highly trusted participants generating deal flow and deciding on investments...

messages.content: I'll work up a direct tokenomics proposal for $HYPE as well.

Sounds good. What areas are we looking to gather feedback? Initially we dove into discussion over on investments/terms but seems we might be heading down a different path. I do believe bootstrapping the community is the hardest part of the process so this part is rather important (considering the heavy DAO focus).
yes, would be great if possible
There'd just be other bounties for long-term contributors that insure maintainability & security. In order for a bounty task to be approved it'd be passed by this group.
do contributions ie: website development or marketing tasks qualify for $HYPE or only bounties?
I believe the point of bounties is to formally delegate tasks such as dev or marketing and provide $HYPE as a means of productivity
Awesome that HYPE is gonna be given out for bounties. Have you got any thoughts on how this process will be managed?
More info being released soon
I'm specifically curious about what tool you are thinking about using for this actually since my team's working on a relevant project. Mind if I send you a DM?
Go ahead
👍 friend request sent
@nicklinck  can we mine or stake the token
Are you referring to $HYPE?
yes can we mine it @kevalin
I'm quite confused
Yes you can "mine" (earn) it by completing bounties
There's no staking atm
I'm writing a doc on the token soon
@kevalin minig like bitcoin proof of work or staking like ethereum
No there will be none of this
It's a token
ERC-20
We don't have our own consensus layer
oh k great @kevalin
i meant if past contributions -- pre-bounty tasks -- qualify for $HYPE. Folks in here have been doing dev or marketing stuff... do they get tokens? or any only ppl who complete bounties?
Past contributions get airdrop
@kevalin great
roger that and gm
How will you be tracking contributions?
@Maxximum Time  through tokenomics and blockchain accounting .
Well that doesnt mean much @rx . Im assuming we will do something similar to what Bankless did and do a retro for early contributors and then going forward have a contributor metric model
Oh k @JayIRL
see @JayIRL kevalin is already on it. Let him finish the doc first.
